page.title: 01The location of Pontycymer
page.content: Pontycymer, a mining settlement, eight miles north of Bridgend,on the South Wales coalfield, stands on the River Garw which has cut a deep "V-shaped" valley and it is in the narrow valley bottom that Pontycmer grew up. The Mid Glamorgan anticline brings coal fairly close to the surface, and thus Pontycymer's growth has been based entirely on the coal industry. The Garw Valley can be considered as typical of any of the South Wales Coalfield valleys through its industrial history, social and economic structures and physical setting. As most other mining areas, it has gradually declined since its peak before the First World War. This decline, unfortunately highlights the plight of all South Wales Valleys .
